data.title: Small Eatery With Quality Dishes
data.text: I enjoyed the bbq bacon cheddar burger and fries and it was nothing short of great! It was juicy and had thick slices of bacon which were fried to perfection. My friend enjoyed their penne pasta and shrimp and from the looks of her bowl she definitely enjoyed it. The staff was very attentive and displayed outstanding customer service skills. I will definitely return.

data.title: Inglewood's Best!
data.text: My family and I have visited this place countless times, it's my mothers favorite place to go when she's visiting us from Belize. It's a welcoming, clean and pleasant environment. The food is scrumptious, the burgers are especially mouth watering and my moms favorite is their Belgium waffles and bully omelette. We love this place!!!

data.title: Great find in the Neighborhood
data.text: After hearing great things about this (small) place, I decided to give it a try. Loved it.  Breakfast was  really good, prepared just the way you want your breakfast prepared, not greasy, just good. I had a regular breakfast with sausage, eggs and home fries which were the best I've ever had in a restaurant.  Saw many people ordering the waffles so they must be good.    The service was over the top excellent.  The one person waiting tables was remarkable and inspired me to leave a generous tip. Not only was she highly efficient in working the tables, she was really sweet and pleasant. The space is small but its comfortable and there is some outdoor seating.  If you live in the area, you should definitely give it a try and if you live outside of the area its worth the trip.

data.title: Up and coming eatery
data.text: I've been here several times and felt good about it every time! I'd give it 5 stars if the service was a bit more attentive. The food is above average and well prepared. I'd readily take a breakfast or lunch date to this restaurant. I think it will only become even more popular as time goes on. If I weren't married I'd probably go here more often but my wife is an excellent cook.

data.title: Home cooking and great service
data.text: I am so thrilled Rusty Pot opened up in my neighborhood! I will confess, I wasn't thrilled about the name, but someone I trusted went and said he had an awesome experience, so that was enough to get me in the door. I am so happy I did! THE best green beans I have EVER eaten anywhere (dare I say even better than my Granny's green beans?); fluffy Belgian waffles and hot, perfectly seasoned chicken wings give Roscoe's a run for their money; service with a smile and personal touch make this a great experience. I would recommend Rusty Pot to anyone looking for a meal made with love.

data.title: A surprise hidden gem.
data.text: This is my new fav spot... the food is cooked fresh to order(so be a little patient), but it comes out hot and delicious.  It is a quaint spot to enjoy good food.

data.title: Finally Tried It!
data.text: Heard about the Rusty Pot from my sister and decided I would give it a try.  So my sister and I had a late after my vacation and boy was it good. I like the waffles better than Roscoes. The catfish was nice and crispy and the potatoes were yummy.  I know it's a small place but I don't care when the food is that good. And the price was right too

data.title: Chicken n Waffles
data.text: I love their chicken in waffles. Priced just right. Great Service and good food. Will definitely go back.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Stopped in for lunch before heading up to Ventura for a wedding! It was a nice place with friendly service. The weather is beautiful outside and the food tasted great! Shrimp and grits and the "rusty pot" burger.

data.title: Rusty Pot Cafe
data.text: I enjoyed eating my breakfast on a sidewalk table just outside of the restaurant.  Jay, my server, was pleasant and friendly and added to the enjoyment of my meal.  I ordered grits with scrambled eggs, applewood bacon, and sourdough toast.  Everything was prepared to my taste, and a I do plan to return for their BOGO breakfast special (Buy One, Get One FREE) now that I have a coupon.  In the meantime, please keep the rusty pot on the fire.

data.title: What a Find  - Give it a try - you won't be sorry
data.text: I used yelp and tripadvisor to find this place and so glad I did.  While  by the airport in LA at lunch time my associate and I tried the new Rusty Pot Cafe.  This little place is owned and run by a mother daughter combo.  Mom cooks and Michelle is the server. The menu isn't extensive and has the southern Cajun influence.  We started out with the Parmesan  truffle fries.  WoW these are great.  Then I had the gumbo and by associate had a burger.  My gumbo was just like being in Louisiana - excellent and by associate said it was one of the best burgers he's had.  Stop by and see these folks, you'll be glad you did!

data.title: Charming Spot with Tasty Food
data.text: We just stopped in for a late lunch & had a wonderful surprise with how good the food was.  The chicken & sausage gumbo was great.  The fried chicken wings were wonderful -- super crispy, but also very lightly coated. It was really good! Our server was very friendly & attentive.
